s: Pepsi and Starbucks joined forces in 1994 to create the North American Coffee Partnership (NACP) to market cold ready-to-drink coffee products under the Starbucks name and using the Pepsi distribution network. The joint venture's first product, Frappuccino, quickly dominated the category.

t: SEC
s: The Company has two non-retail domestic 50-50 joint ventures. The North American Coffee Partnership, a joint venture with the Pepsi-Cola Company, a division of PepsiCo, Inc., was formed in fiscal 1994 to develop and distribute ready-to-drink coffee-based products.
